intro: Golowninia japonica, commonly known as Japanese golowninia, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of about 30 to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and slightly hairy, while the flowers are clustered in whorls at the ends of the stems. Golowninia japonica prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
